intro: Digitalis minor subsp. palaui, commonly known as the lesser foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces showy, upright spikes of flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
